other_tests.findings: Identification of a novel 15-bp deletion (c.81_95del), resulting in loss of five amino acids (alanine 28 to arginine 32) in the N terminus of Kir6.2.
Heterozygous channels exhibited significantly larger resting whole-cell currents than wild-type channels, indicating a reduction in ATP sensitivity.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No significant changes over time; current remained larger than wild-type in the heterozygous state.

other_tests.findings: The interaction between SUR1 residues 196-288 and Kir6.2 was significantly reduced due to the mutation.
